transcript.text: how was it to have Bob Marley as a
father um he was very young you know lot
of energy a lot of playfulness
discipline too when it's time to work he
was very serious but when it's time to
play he would have a lot of fun why was
it important for you you know to get
involved in such a movie about your
father to make sure it's done the right
way make sure it's authentic and real
and represent my father not in a way
that is
um made for Hollywood but in a in a real
way some of the important pillars for us
was to make sure that his spirituality
was represented R far right make sure
that his pan-africanism was also
represented his militancy was
represented um that his emotion was
represented not what we see on the
outside but what we can see on the
inside as a human being and so this is
what we want people to know it's not
about Bob Mar the person he would um say
the same thing you know it's the message
we I deal with not not not the man
